results.title: The Dangerous Road to the Kabul Airport
results.abstract: Thousands of people have headed to the airport trying to flee, but Taliban fighters have blocked entrances, fired rifles and beaten some people in the crowds.
results.byline: By Lauren Leatherby, Jim Huylebroek, Scott Reinhard and Sarah Kerr

results.title: ‘We’re on Our Own’: Many Earthquake Survivors Expect No Help From Haitian Officials
results.abstract: “No one trusts this government here,” said a farmer in one village where at least 20 residents were killed by the quake as they attended a funeral at a church that collapsed.
results.byline: By Anatoly Kurmanaev and Andre Paultre

results.title: First Resistance to Taliban Rule Tests Afghanistan’s Uncertain Future
results.abstract: While the militants appear firmly in control, some prominent figures vowed to continue resistance as protests erupted in two cities and millions of Afghans parsed clues about the Taliban’s intentions.

results.title: Seeking Global Recognition, Taliban Take a New Approach: Making Nice
results.abstract: The group’s head-spinning claims of moderation follow a common playbook for rebel-held governments, with mixed lessons for Afghanistan’s future.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

multimedia.caption: An armored personnel carrier driven by Taliban fighters in Kabul on Monday. The group needs to persuade foreign powers to send aid and lift sanctions if it is to reconstitute the bare essentials of a government.

results.title: Israel, Once the Model for Beating Covid, Faces New Surge of Infections
results.abstract: One of the most vaccinated societies, Israel now has one of the highest infection rates in the world, raising questions about the vaccine’s efficacy.

results.title: Collapse and Conquest: The Taliban Strategy That Seized Afghanistan
results.abstract: Starting in the spring, the Taliban negotiated wholesale surrenders and seized roadways and weapons, handing them vital propaganda victories and freedom to move quickly to the next opportunity.

results.title: Hong Kong Police Arrest Students Over ‘Advocating Terrorism’
results.abstract: The student union leaders, who were detained under the national security law, had expressed sympathy for a man who stabbed a police officer before killing himself.

results.title: Earthquake and floods have set back Haiti’s faltering effort to curb the pandemic.

results.title: Bill Davis, Pragmatic Ontario Premier, Dies at 92
results.abstract: A champion of education in his province, he helped his nation achieve sovereignty from Britain by brokering a 1982 compromise.

multimedia.caption: Bill Davis, who was the premier of Ontario for 14 years, in an undated photo. He attributed his electoral success to a political pragmatism that left his rivals on the fringes.
multimedia.copyright: Reg Innell/Toronto Star, via Getty Images
